newsitem.title: USA: Pioneer-Standard sees ongoing margin pressures.
newsitem.headline: Pioneer-Standard sees ongoing margin pressures.

text.p: Pioneer-Standard Electronics Inc said Tuesday it expects continued pressure on margins in the near term.
Earlier Tuesday the company reported third quarter earnings of $0.24 per share, up from $0.18 per share in the year-ago quarter.
The company said that overall, its earnings reflect continuation of a weak pricing environment in the industry and a shift in product mix to lower-margin items.

"The market is showing modest signs of improvement. However, we expect continued pressure on margins in the near term," the company said in a release. "Our focus will be on taking costs out of the organization where possible, while driving revenue growth."
